cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend tonight, then forecast to ride up the U.S. East Coast and stall just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic/New England waters Sun–Mon.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near the Suwannee River/Keaton Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from north of Surf City, NC to Oregon Inlet, NC including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL, Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC; Hurricane warning Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. coastline from the Florida Gulf Coast through the Mid-Atlantic to New England
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (1–3 ft surge around NY/NJ Harbor at high tide)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph, isolated higher gusts) possible Sunday as the center passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal inundation of 1–3 ft possible at high tide along lower NY Harbor, Raritan Bay and the south shore of Long Island.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday could total 1–3 inches with localized higher amounts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding at times of high tide.
